posts.name: zombie
posts.cooked:
hi! iâ€™m the coder for 5213 SHIELD and im brand new to it this year. our coder last year graduated and didnt leave us with many resources. iâ€™ve gotten so far as to being able to put in our swerve drive and our robot can drive (yay!) but i cant get the arm motors to go into the code. if i could get some help, thatâ€™d be great! thank you!

we use talon fx falcon 500 motors for the entire project!

posts.name: Drakxii
posts.cooked: Do you have git or anyway else for us to look at your code?

posts.name: abuddies
posts.cooked:
Iâ€™m not exactly sure what language youâ€™re coding in (Java, C++, Python), but I can provide example code in Java and some general advice.

Firstly, I would recommend writing some simple code that should work (to test and see if thereâ€™s any mechanical/electrical issues that need to be fixed before code can do anything).

If this doesnâ€™t work, Iâ€™d check a couple of things:

While trying to run the motor with code, hold the motor. If it feels like itâ€™s vibrating or getting hot, thereâ€™s probably something wrong with the gears or the key (this is a mechanical issue, not a code issue).

Connect to the robot using Phoenix Tuner X (or just normal Phoenix Tuner). Make sure that the firmware is up-to-date, the port number is unique, and you could also try running the motor to see if itâ€™s a gear problem.

Look at the status lights and compare with these status lights . Make sure that you have a CAN connection and are sending a signal (normally, the status lights blink red at the same time when driving in reverse and green when driving normally. If theyâ€™re blinking alternately red, there is a connection issue)

posts.name: zombie
posts.cooked: Thank you so much!!â€™ Oh my gosh!!!

posts.cooked: if you need more info try to reference the Documentation it can be very helpful Phoenix 6 Documentation and if you need to look for a specific function and get a better idea of how a method or class works read the java API docs Overview (CTRE Phoenix 6 Java 25.3.0)
